text: The MiG-19 Farmer was a Soviet fighter aircraft made by Mikoyan. It first flew in 1953 and was introduced in 1955. It was meant to replace the older MiG-17 Fresco. During the Vietnam War, it was used a little by the North Vietnamese but not as much as the MiG-17 or MiG 21 Fishbed.http://home.comcast.net/~anneled/usvictor.html It had 3 30mm cannon, and could carry 4 bombsor rockets. It weighed 11,397 pounds (5,170 kilograms) empty and could weigh up to 19,621 pounds (8,900 kilograms) at the heaviest. It was powered by 2 Tumansky RD-9 jet engines, each had 7,165 pounds (3250 kilograms) of thrust with afterburner. It was 12 feet (3.6576 meters) high, had a wingspan of 29.5 feet (9 meters), and was 42 feet 11 in (13.1 meters) long. It could go 903 miles per hour (1,450 kilometers per hour), and was the first supersonic Soviet fighter. Eventually, it was replaced by the newer MiG-21. ==Related pages== * MiG-17 Fresco * MiG-21 Fishbed * F-8 Crusader * F-4 Phantom II == References == Category:Soviet military aircraft Category:Polish military aircraft Category:Vietnamese military aircraft Category:Cold War Category:Vietnam War aircraft
title: Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-19
